title: Gateway: primary key of the identities table should include a unique user ID from the auth provider
author: g-linville

comments.body: To test this, just describe the `identities` table using the `.schema identities` command in SQLite or `\d identities` in PostgreSQL. You should see that the primary key consists of `auth_provider_name`, `auth_provider_namespace`, and `provider_user_id`.

You should be able to update seamlessly if using PostgreSQL. If you have an existing SQLite DB prior to PR #1744 being merged, then you will need to delete it and start again. I think we only use SQLite for dev (we definitely don't use it in production), so this shouldn't be an issue.

When testing with latest build , following is the PRIMARY KEY for `identities` table:

 "identities_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (auth_provider_name, auth_provider_namespace, provider_user_id)

title: Validate workspace provider configuration on startup
body: When the workspace provider is not configured correctly, there are esoteric failures that are hard to decipher. We need to a validation of the workspace-provider configuration on startup to better communicate issues to the user.
author: thedadams

comments.body:
The easiest way to test this is to set the `OBOT_WORKSPACE_PROVIDER_TYPE` environment variable to `s3` without setting any of the other configuration variables. This will show the "negative" outcome by logging an error and quitting with a nonzero exit code.

The "positive" outcome is already tested in the three hosted environments.

Start server  by providing `-e OBOT_WORKSPACE_PROVIDER_TYPE=s3` configuration.
This results in failure to start the server and it exits with status 1.
 
Following error reported in logs
```
time="2025-02-19T17:07:46Z" level=error msg="failed to run tool [Validate Environment Variables] cmd [/bin/sh -c exec ${GPTSCRIPT_TOOL_DIR}/bin/gptscript-go-tool validate-env]: exit status 1" logger=-ai/gptscript@v0.9.6-0.20250206173916-bf1b00027193/pkg/engine
time="2025-02-19T17:07:46Z" level=info msg="Handled request: method POST, path /run" id=46002bf1-1d19-4031-8347-34516995f847
2025/02/19 17:07:46 failed to validate environment variables: run encountered an error: ERROR: 2025/02/19 17:07:46 s3 provider requires a bucket name
: exit status 1 with error output: failed to run: ERROR: 2025/02/19 17:07:46 s3 provider requires a bucket name
```

title: Remove Chat interface from Agent Edit Page

comments.body: We do not have the ability to chat with the agents in Edit Agent page anymore.

title: [question] how to add new auth provider?
body:
i understand that i will need to fork the tools repo and add one there.

however, i'm not sure what other step do i need in order for it to show up in auth provider web admin.

any pointers are much appreciated
author: tuananh

comments.body:
hi @tuananh , to display your new auth provider, you would need to reference it in `index.yaml`:

for example:
```
authProviders:
  github-auth-provider:
    reference: ./github-auth-provider
  google-auth-provider:
    reference: ./google-auth-provider
  your-new-auth-provider:
    reference: ./<new-auth-provider-implementation-dir>
```

> hi @tuananh , to display your new auth provider, you would need to reference it in `index.yaml`:
> 
> for example:
> ```
> authProviders:
>   github-auth-provider:
>     reference: ./github-auth-provider
>   google-auth-provider:
>     reference: ./google-auth-provider
>   your-new-auth-provider:
>     reference: ./<new-auth-provider-implementation-dir>
> ```

thank you. i just figured that out yesterday

title: fix: Missed some words
body: Missed some words in admin dashboard
author: stefanmcshane

comments.body: Thanks!

title: Google Search always uses the same session for all threads
body: The Google Search tool is using a single browser session across all threads in Obot. It should be using a dedicated browser session for each thread.
author: njhale

comments.body:
Google search tool call being made for every new thread results in the following process to be created:

```
root      7731  4444  1 19:56 ?        00:00:04 /opt/google/chrome/chrome --disable-field-trial-config --disable-background-networking --disable-background-timer-throttling --disable-backgr
root      7733     1  0 19:56 ?        00:00:00 /chrome-linux/chrome_crashpad_handler --monitor-self --monitor-self-annotation=ptype=crashpad-handler --database=/data/.config/chromium/Crash
root      7735     1  0 19:56 ?        00:00:00 /chrome-linux/chrome_crashpad_handler --no-periodic-tasks --monitor-self-annotation=ptype=crashpad-handler --database=/data/.config/chromium/
root      7738  7731  0 19:56 ?        00:00:00 /chrome-linux/chrome --type=zygote --no-zygote-sandbox --no-sandbox --headless --string-annotations --crashpad-handler-pid=0 --enable-crash-r
root      7739  7731  0 19:56 ?        00:00:00 /chrome-linux/chrome --type=zygote --no-sandbox --headless --string-annotations --crashpad-handler-pid=0 --enable-crash-reporter=, --noerrdia
root      7760  7738  0 19:56 ?        00:00:00 /chrome-linux/chrome --type=gpu-process --no-sandbox --disable-dev-shm-usage --disable-breakpad --headless --ozone-platform=headless --use-an
root      7761  7731  0 19:56 ?        00:00:01 /chrome-linux/chrome --type=utility --utility-sub-type=network.mojom.NetworkService --lang=en-US --service-sandbox-type=none --no-sandbox --d
root      7762  7739  0 19:56 ?        00:00:00 /chrome-linux/chrome --type=utility --utility-sub-type=storage.mojom.StorageService --lang=en-US --service-sandbox-type=utility --no-sandbox 
root      7810  7739  0 19:56 ?        00:00:00 /chrome-linux/chrome --type=renderer --string-annotations --crashpad-handler-pid=0 --enable-crash-reporter=, --noerrdialogs --user-data-dir=/
```

When more google search tool calls are made in the same thread , then the same session gets used.
When I chatted in the same thread after 5 minutes , this resulted in older processes  getting deleted and new ones getting created.
We would expect the same process to be used in this case ?

If there are tool calls made  after 3 minutes in the same thread , i see the same process being used and only this process gets created 
```
root   9322 8969 0 20:16 ?    00:00:00 /chrome-linux/chrome --type=renderer --string-annotations --crashpad-handler-pid=0 --enable-crash-reporter=, --noerrdialogs --user-data-dir=/
```

@njhale Wanted confirmation on this behavior?

Also I see browser session related threads getting deleted even before 10 minutes of idle time. They seem to get deleted 10 minutes after they get created even if they were being used few minutes back for a tool call.

@sangee2004 The expected behavior is:
- if no browser session (process) exists for that thread when a `Google Search` call is made, a new one is spun up
- the thread's browser process is cleaned up 5 minutes after the last `Google Search` call is made in that thread
- after a thread's browser processes is cleaned up due to inactivity, the next `Google Search` call in that thread will cause a new browser process spin up for the thread

I'd say what you're seeing is the expected behavior.

> When I chatted in the same thread after 5 minutes , this resulted in older processes getting deleted and new ones getting created.

This was right on the inactivity threshold, so the cleanup of that process probably started before the `Google Search` call was made. No issue here, most likely a coincidence that it was deleted around the time you started chatting again.

title: Provide a way to show (and clear) agent level credentials available at the agent level
body:
**Steps to reproduce the problem:**
1. Create an agent with any tool that requires authentication like `github`
2. Enable pre authentication.
3. Remove the tool.
4. Add this tool back

Notice that the tool gets into authenticated state right away without being promoted for creds. 

As a user this is confusing that my tool gets  authenticated right away since it is not obvious at this time that there is a agent level credential still associated with this agent from step 2.

Expected Behavior:
Display credentials available at the agent level . 
Also provide user with the ability to clear these credential.
author: sangee2004

comments.body:
My expectation is that this will be addressed when #1570 gets addressed - we should be removing the agent level credentials when the tool is removed.

Also @sangee2004 - try not to use the term "global credentials" they aren't global. They're agent scoped, so you can call them agent-level or agent-scoped creds. We may actually have global level creds some day and i dont want to confuse the two.
When a pre authenticated tool associated with an agent is deleted , agent level credentials relating to the tool gets removed if it is the only tool that uses this credential.

title: Authentication mode set on tool does not get respected when it is added again to an agent (after being deleted previously in global auth enabled mode).
body:
**Steps to reproduce the problem**
1. Create agent with tool  - `github` using `oauth`  as authentication mode.
2. Pre authenticate the tool.
3. Remove this tool.
4. Add github tool again this time choosing PAT

Tool will get added into pre authenticated mode ( User was not promoted for PAT tokens)

Removing tool is step 3 does not result in agent level credential for the tool to be removed.

**Expected Behavior:**
When tool is being added to an agent that already has credential set (like in step 4) , user should not be allowed to pick an oauth mode that is different from the credential that already exists.

Or we should be able to clear the existing agent credential and add the tool as being not in pre authenticated mode.
author: sangee2004

comments.body: @thedadams is this one you and i discussed? If so, what was the plan?

This should be the behavior:
> "When the last tool that uses a specific credential is removed from an agent or workflow, then that credential is removed from the agent/workflow context."

This issue is addressed when testing with latest build.
When a pre authenticated tool is deleted , agent level credentials relating to the tool gets removed if it is the only tool that uses this credential.

When testing the workflow mentioned in the issue after step 4 , the tool does not get added in pre authenticated mode as expected.

title: Adding two tools very quickly in the admin UI doesn't always work
body:
1. In the admin UI, click the "Add Tools" button.
2. Add two tools very quickly. Preferably two that don't support tokens like Bluesky and Browser.

It will not always be the case that both tools are added: sometimes the first is added, the second, or both.

Clicking to add one tool, waiting a few seconds, and then another almost always works.
author: thedadams

comments.body:
This issue is also seen when adding tool like `Github` which support both PAT and ouath credentials.

1. Create an agent.
2. Add `Github` tool and select any of the authentication method. 

Notice that after this ,  `Github` tool will remain unselected.

Trying to add this again multiple times in the same "add tool" modal will not succeed.

The only way to get around this problem is to quit the tool page and relaunch it again. 
Adding the tool again now will succeed.

@ivyjeong13 Sometimes even multiple attempts to add Gitlab tool keeps failing.
This issue is not seen anymore when testing with latest build.

title: Deleting an agent or workflow with credentials will leave those credentials in the database
body:
These credentials can't be accessed by anything else in the system, but they should be cleaned up when the agent or workflow is deleted.

The easiest way to test this would be locally (without Docker).
1. Run `make dev`.
2. Create an agent. Make note of the ID for later.
3. Add a tool that requires OAuth to that agent and authenticate the tool.
4. Delete the agent.
5. Run `GPTSCRIPT_SQLITE_FILE=/Users/thedadams/code/obot/obot-credentials.db gptscript creds --all-contexts` and you will see a credential for this agent in the output.

Similarly for workflows.
author: thedadams

comments.body:
Credentials created at at agent/workflow level get deleted when agent/workflow  is deleted.

1. Create an agent with github tool and pre authenticate the tool.
```
GPTSCRIPT_SQLITE_FILE=/Users/sangeethahariharan/obot/obot-credentials.db ./gptscript creds --all-contexts
CONTEXT                                CREDENTIAL              EXPIRES IN
a182gff                                github.write            never
c63e9a6e-6e48-4a15-9960-abaee0ef29b2   openai-model-provider   never
```
2. Delete the agent
Credential  related to the agent gets deleted as expected.
```
 GPTSCRIPT_SQLITE_FILE=/Users/sangeethahariharan/obot/obot-credentials.db ./gptscript creds --all-contexts
CONTEXT                                CREDENTIAL              EXPIRES IN
c63e9a6e-6e48-4a15-9960-abaee0ef29b2   openai-model-provider   never
```
3. Create a workflow with gmail tool and pre authenticate the tool.
```
GPTSCRIPT_SQLITE_FILE=/Users/sangeethahariharan/obot/obot-credentials.db ./gptscript creds --all-contexts
CONTEXT                                CREDENTIAL              EXPIRES IN
c63e9a6e-6e48-4a15-9960-abaee0ef29b2   openai-model-provider   never
w1pl5zs                                google                  59m9s
```
4. Delete the workflow
Credential  related to the workflow gets deleted as expected.
```
GPTSCRIPT_SQLITE_FILE=/Users/sangeethahariharan/obot/obot-credentials.db ./gptscript creds --all-contexts
CONTEXT                                CREDENTIAL              EXPIRES IN
c63e9a6e-6e48-4a15-9960-abaee0ef29b2   openai-model-provider   never
```

title: Allow markdown content to be provided when creating Google Docs
body:
Currently, the `Create Google Doc` tool only creates a blank document and necessitates the use of `Update Google Doc` to create a doc with content. This can sometimes confuse the LLM, cause it to hallucinate a `content` parameter, and not make the required `Update Google Doc` call afterwards.

Add a `content` parameter to the `Create Google Doc` tool so that the LLM doesn't need to make a second tool call to create a doc with initial content.
author: njhale

comments.body:
Tested with `github.com/obot-platform/tools:eda592f` 

There is only 1 create call being made to create document. Document gets created with contents as expected.

title: Fix: Don't ignore obot frame in debug view
body:
When contructing the debug view, we would ignore certain frames, but it
seems we should not ignore frames where the tool is named obot, because
that is the name of the root frame for threads from the obot agent.

Signed-off-by: Craig Jellick <craig@acorn.io>
author: cjellick

comments.body: I believe the reason this was added was to ignore the Obot model provider tool. My guess is that removing this will cause that tool call to show up in the debug view. Perhaps there is a better way to ignore that.
had a feeling that might be the case

Properly fixed and actually tested it @thedadams.

Arguably, we could _just_ rely on the model provider check, but i dont really know if that shows up anywhere else where we'd want to show it. Do you?

I don't believe there are any situations where model providers are shown there. The model providers are started by the obot proxy, which essentially is the obot model provider.

So, I think it's safe to just use the modelProvider field here.

I'm fine with the change either way.

title: Agent introduction not updating & embedded html markdown support
body:
To reproduce: 
* Create a new Agent
* Type into the Introduction textbox area first.
* Notice it does not save. 
* Add a starter message. From then on, the introduction seems to save the update on change.

To reproduce:
* Go to an agent
* Type html into the Introduction textbox area ex. `<h1>Hello<h1>`
* See that that html is shown instead of being rendered in the markdown area
author: ivyjeong13

comments.body:
Adding introduction as the first field when creating an agent results in changes being saved to agent.
Using html markdown gets rendered as expected.

title: make ui items not show up as fillable from 1password
body: all our password field having 1password fillers drives me nuts. there is a css class you can add to make them ignored. would like us to add this to most places we have passwor fields
author: cjellick

comments.body:
@cjellick do we want to disable 1password for all of our users? I could definitely see a use case where users store various credentials in 1p which would be very useful for autofill.

We could add a setting that enables/disables 1password via localstorage, so you could block it for your own setup?

What password fields do we have where that would be useful? 1password shines where you have to enter the same password often on the same site. We arent really setup that way. We generally ask you for a token you generated on a different site and then it's saved indefinitely as part of configuration. But maybe I'm not thinking of some fields.
1password fillers is not available for password fields anymore.

title: Rename the database tool "Exec"
body: The database tool bundle has a tool just called "Exec". That is confusing and gets conflated with the idea of execing a program. Darren and I got confused by it. Can we rename it?
author: cjellick

comments.body:
Database bundle tool names have been renamed to:
- `List Database Tables`
- `Run Database Query`
- `Exec Database Statement`

Database bundle tool names have been renamed to following when testing with latest build:

```
Here are the available function calls you can use:

List Database Tables: This tool returns a list of tables in the database.

Exec Database Statement: This tool executes a valid SQLite3 statement against the database.

Run Database Query: This tool runs a valid SQLite3 query against the database and returns the results.
```

title: Gracefully terminate the search tool when Obot exits
body: The npm server for the search tool is never terminated when the Obot server is shut down; it's supposed to gracefully exit when this happens.
author: njhale

comments.body:
This issue is not seen anymore when testing with latest build.

1. Start a otto server locally (using `make dev`)
2. Create an agent with google search tool and chat with it relating to search tool like `Who won 2024 superbowl`
3. This will result in google search daemon process to be launched
```
  501 41655 41438   0  4:42PM ttys004    0:00.05 /var/folders/7x/wj1zrf9s5m92pmf8nctz5cs00000gn/T/go-build1455727278/b001/exe/main sys.daemon /usr/bin/env npm --prefix /Users/sangeethahariharan/Library/Caches/gptscript/repos/43e132b64079e5e90ff70c79d0c0c33dcbf25e74/google/search/tool.gpt/node20/google/search run server
```
4. Quit  otto server (using ^c)

After this , the google search daemon process also gets terminated as expected.

title: Improve ingestion limit rules
body:
Right now, we have a limit of 250 pages when scraping a page. Let's separate scraping from ingestion and have two different limits. You should be able to scrape a much higher number of pages so that you can select which pages to ingest.

Also, make these fields configurable as env vars instead of hard coded.
author: cjellick

comments.body: This is configurable through an Env variable, but yes we should be able to raise the limit to a higher number due to the various improvement we have made. I will do some scaling test and raise the number accordingly.

We also have a per-agent limit that is set to limit the number of files an agent(dataset) can ingest. Currently it is set to 1000. We should adjust that accordingly. Although we would need some testing to prove that increasing the number of files in dataset doesn't deteriorate the result from retrival.

As it for now, Since we have made progress in addressing instability issues from ingestion, i have bumped the following limit:

1. Scrape limit for a single website source increased from 250 to 2000.
2. The number of ingested file per agent has been increased from 1000 to 3000.

When testing with the latest builds , following are the limits:

1. Scrape limit for a single website is 2000.
2. Limit on the number of ingested file per agent is 3000.

title: Eliminate gateway integrations
body: Darren and I (and then Will and I) had a conversation about getting rid of our built-in gateway-backed oauth integrations and just requiring the user to always do it. Maybe we can have them on in the OSS release but not the enterprise release?
author: cjellick

comments.body:
As part of this we'd need to do what is defined in #905:

> The Gateway currently hosts the default OAuth app configurations. The user can override those by creating OAuth apps in the admin UI.
> 
> In order to decommision Gateway, if that becomes desired, we need the default OAuth apps to be in Acorn.
@thedadams correct to put this to test?

With both enterprise and oss builds , no auth provider or oauth providers relating to any tools is pre configured.

User will need to configure the oauth providers (relating to Auth / tools) if they want to use them. Able to configure oauth providers (relating to Auth and tools and work with them successfully.

title: Ability to cancel/abort a workflow

title: Browser screenshot links are broken
body: The `Screenshot` tool always produces download URLs with the thread ID of the thread the `Browser` tool daemon was started in. This means that if you take a screenshot in a different thread, the URL will have the wrong thread ID component. They should use the thread ID of the thread the `Screenshot` tool was called from.
author: njhale

comments.body:
Able to use Browser tool to take screenshots across multiple threads successfully.

Create an agent with Browser tool .
Take screenshot for a webpage in one thread. This succeeds.
Start a new thread and take a screenshot for a webpage . This succeeds.

Create another agent with Browser tool .
Take screenshot for a webpage in one thread.This succeeds.

title: Add indexing to kinm
body:
We have found that field selectors don't work very well when there are a lot of objects. We list all the objects from the database and process them in code. Based on the number of objects, this can hurt performance.

Based on an "offline" conversation:

Each field selector should be a column in the database. This column should be a nullable string. The `WHERE` clause should return objects who column value is `NULL` as well as those that match the string. This is for migration purposes: the code will still filter out any objects that don't have this column set and whose field selector value doesn't match.

Don't index these columns by default. The `WHERE` clause on the column may be enough to get the performance increase we need.

We use an interface to do field selectors. Add a method to this interface to indicate which columns should be indexed. Then the indexes can be added when the database is migrated on startup.
author: thedadams

comments.body: @ibuildthecloud said he was going to do this. Maybe he delegated it to you donnie, but I think my convo with him was more recent than this issue.
This change has been merged. This results in better performance when loading knowledge files.

title: UI - React Router Upgrade
body:
Remix (the framework) is being swallowed by it's predecessor, React Router in it's V7 Release.

This will provide some benefits among:
- improved type safety with route modules
- better community support (developers no longer have to split knowledge between React Router and Remix, so solutions will be more cohesive)
- General performance, cleanliness within the framework
- Easier upgrades going forward since all upgrades will funnel through React Router

It should be a simple upgrade since we've already implemented **most** of future flags provided by Remix intended for swapping. Additionally they have provided a codemod that handles trivial updates like imports and package names
author: ryanhopperlowe

comments.body:
No issues seen with UI pages being rendered after this upgrade.
Closing this issue.

title: Fix: Add agent.status.textEmbedding and set it in controller
body: We are making multiple requests in agent list call because it needs to fetch the knowledge set for each agent to get textEmbeddingModel. The call becomes extremely slow when database is on load or ingestion is running. So add the the embedding field in agent.status directly and set it in controller to avoid extra api calls when listing agent.

title: Add SQLite tools
body:
## Overview

Add a set of tools that allow agents to execute SQLite statements and queries against a thread-scoped SQLite database.

## Details

(from a conversation with @cjellick)

- The tool should be structured around the use case of having DB associated to an otto thread.
- The tool should be loading and/or writing a sqlite file on every tool call. In hosted environments, this will actually be writing all the way to S3. That may cause lag, but thats where we want to start and see how bad it is.
- The inputs and output of the tool should be raw, meaning we want the tool to accept sql(lite) statements and return sql output. Itll be up to the calling agent/gptscript to form the query & format the response.
- Generally, we want markdown tables to be the default way the agent outputs data from queries.
- The tools context should be where the magic happens to the calling agent know how to use it. It should do things like:
  - Tell the LLM it can create and modify tables and should do so on demand.
  - Dump the DB schema into the context so the llm knows its form. Maybe even a row from each table?
- The goal is that the user shouldnt really see the sql. They should be able to ask things in natural language and should see results as markdown tables.
- Not too important to the impl, but FYI if we ran this in a SaaS, we might use turso (sqlite saas) to back it
- Tool should support creating and modifying tables and rows. Probably delete rows and tables too (but that randomly seems scary to me :shrug:)
- A sample user message for this: List my emails and store them in a table with these columns...
author: njhale

comments.body:
Using SQLite bundle , i am able to perform the following basic action using prompts in  natural language

1. Create table
2. Modify table and add more columns
3. Delete table
4. Add new rows to table
5. Delete existing rows
6. Modify existing rows

title: Credentials relating to env do not get cleared when environment variable is deleted(or edited) for a workflow.
body:
**Steps to reproduce the problem:**
**Scenario 1:**

1. Register a  tool with url - `github.com/sangee2004/gptscript/tools/testenv` ( simple tool that print paramter and environment variable)
2. Created a workflow with env variable `MY_ENV`, parameter `PROMPT` and add the tool from step 1.
3. Add a step with `print`
4. Use `Authenticate` and enter value for `MY_ENV` when prompted for it.
5. Use `Run workflow` to run the workflow.
6. Delete the env variable `MY_ENV`
7. Run `Authenticate` ( You dont have to do this step as well). 
8. Use `Run workflow` to run the workflow again.
Tool call will fail with needing environment variable which is as expected.
9. Add  env variable `MY_ENV` back.
10.  Use `Authenticate` 
Notice that we are not prompted to enter `MY_ENV` variable ( the credential created from step4 is still present) and presented with `DONE`.
11. Use `Run workflow` to run the workflow.
Tool will get the value for `MY_ENV` as the value set in step 4.

**Expected Behavior:**
Deleting environment variable in step 6 , should have deleted the related credential.
`Authenticate`  in step 10 should prompt the user to enter  `MY_ENV` variable.


**Scenario 2:**
1. Created a workflow with env variable `MY_ENV`
2. `Authenticate`

credential relating to env gets created as expected.
```
w16fmf6::MY_ENV       MY_ENV       never
```

3. Edit the `MY_ENV` to `MY_ENV_mod`
4. `Authenticate`

This results in new credential relating to `MY_ENV_mod` getting created.
credential relating to `MY_ENV` continues to remain.
```
w16fmf6::MY_ENV       MY_ENV       never
w16fmf6::MY_ENV_mod   MY_ENV_mod   never
```

**Expected Behavior:**
credential relating to `MY_ENV` should get deleted.
author: sangee2004

comments.body: The entire flow for setting/getting env vars is going to be updated.
im just going to close this since the new flow is going to be so different

title: Provide a way to pull latest changes made to a registered tool on demand.
body:
**Steps to reproduce the problem:**
1. Register a new tool from a github repo.
2. Add this tool to an agent.
3. Chat with the agent that involves this tool call.
4.  Make some changes to the tool in the github repo.

There is no way for me to use the new version of the tool.

Even when I delete the tool and add the same tool again, I only get the version of the tool from step1 (changes from step4 are not available).


**Expected Behavior:**
Provide a way to pull latest changes made to a registered tool on demand.
author: sangee2004

comments.body:
The backend changes for this PR have merged and this is ready for UI work.

The API for "force refresh" of a tool reference is `POST /api/tool-references/{id}/force-refresh`.
@cjellick - should this be available on all tools or just custom ones?
Custom. @thedadams did you put distinguish between the two?

@cjellick @thedadams - The api that the backend exposes here seems to return an asynchronous response. My steps:

- Update tool 
- Force Refresh Tool
- refetch `GET /api/tool-references?type=tool`

I do not see the list update as I'd expect. Refreshing gets the new data.

options here are to either make the response synchronous or implement Polling in the UI. ~~If we were to go with Polling, I'd probably want some indicator as to when the tool was last updated so I know when to stop polling for the updates~~

Edit: I tried using `revision` as an indicator, but that did not help because there will be times where `Force Refresh` is triggered and there will be no changes to the repo. In this scenario, polling would start but never stop (unless with an arbitrary timeout)

With this in mind polling is not a good solution and I'd push to make the api synchronous. Very open to discussion on the matter though.

WDYT?
Able to pull the latest version for custom tools using "Refresh Tool" option provided the tool in the `Tools` page.

Did the following change based on feedback
1. Move the pgvector build stage into a separate step. And copy the necessary artifacts to the final image after it is done.
2. Use `cgr.dev/chainguard/postgres:latest-dev` as the final image. Noticed that we can't use `cgr.dev/chainguard/postgres:latest` because it is a `distroless` image that doesn't come with `apk`
3. Use `/data/postgresql` as data store for postgresql so that we can persist database with existing `/data` volume.

title: Add JIRA Tool
body:
We would like to request the addition of a JIRA tool to the repository. This tool should enable users to interact with JIRA, including creating, updating, and querying issues.

**Proposed Features:**

Create JIRA Issue: Allow users to create new issues in JIRA.
Update JIRA Issue: Enable users to update existing issues in JIRA.
Query JIRA Issues: Provide functionality to search and retrieve issues from JIRA.
Add Comments to JIRA Issues: Allow users to add comments to existing JIRA issues.

**Benefits:**

Streamline project management by integrating JIRA with the existing toolset.
Improve productivity by allowing users to manage JIRA issues directly from the repository.
Enhance collaboration by providing a unified interface for issue tracking and management.

**Additional Information:**

The tool should support authentication with JIRA using similar OAUTH mechanisms in place today.
It should handle different JIRA projects and issue types.
The tool should provide clear error messages and handle exceptions gracefully.


Thank you for considering this feature request. We believe that adding a JIRA tool will greatly enhance the functionality of the repository and benefit all users.
author: billabongrob

comments.body:
Able to configure Atlassian Oauth App successfully following the instructions provided for the Oauth provider.

Created an agent with `jira` bundle and was able to do the following:

```
Create JIRA Issue: Allow users to create new issues in JIRA.
Update JIRA Issue: Enable users to update existing issues in JIRA.
Query JIRA Issues: Provide functionality to search and retrieve issues from JIRA.
Add Comments to JIRA Issues: Allow users to add comments to existing JIRA issues.

```

Was also able to use all other tools available in the bundle. I have not been able to test `list priorities` tool which i will be following up on.

title: Cannot change default model

Attempting to change the default model always results in the following error:

`model gpt-4o is already the default model`

I think the user experience is potentially what's broken here -- trying to set a new default should warn the user that they are making the change and that it will affect other users. You should not get an error when attempting to set a new default that there is already a default set.

title: Knowledge - `[SHOULD NOT HAPPEN] failed to update managedFields  error=` seen in logs when deleting agent when ingestion of files is still in progress.
body:
**Steps to reproduce the problem**
1. Create an agent with few local knowledge files.
2. When ingestion is still in progress, delete the agent.

Following errors are seen in logs:

```
ERRO[3460] [SHOULD NOT HAPPEN] failed to update managedFields  error="failed to convert new object (default/wksp1vw2g9; otto.gptscript.ai/v1, Kind=Workspace) to smd typed: .status.currentIngestionRunName: field not declared in schema" name=wksp1vw2g9 namespace=default versionKind="{\"Group\":\"otto.gptscript.ai\",\"Version\":\"v1\",\"Kind\":\"Workspace\"}"
INFO[3460] Handling request: method POST, path /workspaces/create  id=27674f36-5175-4683-93b6-f60004474e31

warning: expected name after CMapName in cmap
INFO[3471] Deleting default/ks175vfn due to missing a1j5m99  logger=/pkg/controller/handlers/cleanup
INFO[3471] Deleting default/wksp1fvqxb due to missing a1j5m99  logger=/pkg/controller/handlers/cleanup

- Add user UI build to `make all`

cc @tylerslaton 

At the moment, the user UI is kinda broken when auth isn't configured. It throws the error below when you try to send a message.

```
404 /invoke/otto/threads/user?async=true: reference otto not found
```
@njhale I don't think this is related to auth. The consumption UI assumes there is an "Otto" agent. That doesn't get setup by default.

title: fix: use different key for tool reference getters
body:
This is a workaround to make the SWR caching work nicely with the getToolReferences function. The reason we do this is because otherwise the SWR cache will not be invalidated between the two function calls and thus break type safety since types in TypeScript are erased at runtime. as-map=true does not exist in the API.

In addition, this PR also updates the ToolGrid to use the same getter as the ToolCatalog.

#292
author: tylerslaton

comments.body: 1 nit, but other than that LGTM!

title: New conversations had on the thread are not reflected when switching between threads or in `thread inspect` view unless a hard refresh is  done.
body:
**Steps to reproduce the problem:**
1. Create an agent and have a chat say `thread1`
2. Go to `agents` view and have another chat with the same agent by launching `edit agent` page say `thread2`
3. Now switch to `thread1` and have a new conversation 
4. Once response is received , switch to `thread2` and then switch back to `thread1`

Notice that `thread1` will not have conversations made in step3.

5. Go to `Threads` view and look at the chat history using `Inspect Thread` option.

Notice that  conversations made in step3 is also missing here.

Conversations made in step3 shows up in the thread on hard refresh.
author: sangee2004

comments.body: @sangee2004 Just want to make sure I understand here: are you saying that everything works as expected after a hard refresh?
@thedadams Yes. Hard refresh fixes the problem.
This seems to be working for me. Can you retest. if it isnt working, can you record a loom because i could not reproduce
This issue is not reproducible when testing with latest builds.

title: Excel tool - Creating a workbook that already exists results in existing workbook being overwritten.
body:
**Steps to reproduce the problem:**
1. Create an agent with `github.com/gptscript-ai/tools/apis/excel/write`
2. Chat with the agent to `Create a new workbook test1 and add rows "test1, test2, test3" and "test11, test21, test31"`
3. Start a new thread and ask to create the same workbook with different data like `Create a new workbook test1 and add rows "hello1, hello2, hello3".

Notice that a new workbook test1 gets created with data from step3 and workbook contents from step2 is lost.

**Expected Behavior:**
Do not allow creation of new workbook when there is already a workbook with that name.
author: sangee2004

comments.body: Im getting rid of the ability to CRUD workbooks. We shold only have tools for reading and writing data to existing workbooks

title: Knowledge - Show ingestion status (inprogress vs completed)  for the agent to reflect the progress/completion of  ingestion state of all knowledge files.
body:
UI - `b236257b3`

**Steps to reproduce the problem:**

1. Create an agent and add ~20 knowledge files.
2. We are provided with ingestion state for each file.

It would be good to have an overall ingestion status (inprogress vs completed)  to reflect the progress/completion of  ingestion state of all knowledge files.
author: sangee2004

comments.body: I think this is covered by the status at the bottom of the knowledge section
Ingestion status is now presented when ingestion is in progress at the agent level for all knowledge files.

title: UI -Knowledge - Pdf files that can not be ingested (like scanned documents) show up as being stuck in "Transformed documents" state forever in ui.
body:
UI - `b236257b3`
**Steps to reproduce the problem:**
1. Create an agent and add a pdf file which is a scanned document.
2. Notice that the file ingestion state gets stuck in "Transformed documents" state forever and UI shows a spinning state icon.

**Expected Behavior:**
Since ingestion action  is complete in this case , UI should show these entries as being completed.
Not sure if we want to provide a state to indicate that we were not able to ingest any data from this document.
author: sangee2004

comments.body: this is actually fixed already
This issue is not seen anymore when testing with latest knowledge tool.

title: Browser tool process doesn't close after workflow runs
body:
The browser tool does not close when a workflow finishes running because it is designed to stay running until the calling process exits. The calling process in this case is Otto Server which is a daemon. 

We need to adjust the behavior to handle the following usecases:

- Multiple workflows need to be able to use the browser tool concurrently, and independently. Meaning they should not share browser state/session/logins, etc.
- A single workflow should use the same browser session throughout the run.
- At the end of a workflow invocation the browser tool should shut down. 
  - If workspaces are preserved, can this be resumed? Is the workspace then tied to the thread? This might be ok.
author: cloudnautique

comments.body: @cloudnautique The Browser tool is also a daemon. It does open browser processes and manage session data separately on a per-thread basis. It also terminates them after a fixed period of inactivity for the respective thread (I think ~10 minutes since the last request). Is this sufficient to meet your requirements?
@njhale yes, this meets the requirements.

title: UI -Stack trace option (view details) option  is not shown for chat messages (from 2nd message) in threads unless refreshed.
body:
Ui - `0097d076`

**Steps to reproduce the problem:**
1. Start chatting with an agent in a new thread.
2. Notice that you will be presented with "<>" (view details) option once the chat response is received.
3. Chat again.
Notice that the "<>" (view details) option is missing once the chat response is received.
On manual refresh/ re entering the thread ,  "<>" (view details) option  is presented.

4. Start chatting in an existing thread.
Notice that the "<>" (view details) option is missing once the chat response is received.
On manual refresh/ re entering the thread ,  "<>" (view details) option  is presented.
author: sangee2004

comments.body: @cjellick @sangee2004 - this should be fixed now
This issue is not seen anymore.

title: Knowledge - Deleted files from onedrive continue to be present in the agent's knowledge.
body:
commit id -`b2d76d80`

**Steps to reproduce the problem:**

1. Create an agent - `otto create`
2. Add knowledge file from onedrive using -`curl localhost:8080/agents/onedrive-links -d '["<one drive share url"]'`
3. Delete one of the files from onedrive location.
4. Sync data using `curl localhost:8080/agents/<agent id>/onedrive-links/<object-id> -X PATCH`
5.  List all the knowledge files using - `curl localhost:8080/agents/<agent id>/knowledge`

Notice that the file delete in step3 continues to be listed

**Expected Behavior:**
Deleted file should get removed from agent's knowledge
author: sangee2004

comments.body: Should already be fixed
This issue is not seen anymore when testing with latest version of knowledge tool.

title: When invoke is used with multiple inputs there is 1 thread that gets created for each input.
body:
commit id - `d7fcd7e95`

**Steps to reproduce the problem**

1. Create an agent.
2. use `invoke` to chat with the agent and add multiple inputs.

```
%otto invoke a1n4kn6 
Input: who won 2024 superbowk
> Input: who won 2024 superbowk
> Waiting for model... 
> Generating tool input for (answersFromTheInternet)...  {"question":"Who won the 2024 Super Bowl?"} 
> Running tool (answers-from-the-internet): {"question":"Who won the 2024 Super Bowl?"}
> Waiting for model... 
The Kansas City Chiefs won the 2024 Super Bowl (Super Bowl LVIII) by defeating the San Francisco 49ers with a score of 25-22 in overtime. Patrick Mahomes, the quarterback for the Chiefs, was named the MVP of the game. 
 
Input: who won 2024 nba
> Input: who won 2024 nba
> Waiting for model... 
> Generating tool input for (answersFromTheInternet)...  {"question":"Who won the 2024 NBA Championship?"} 
> Running tool (answers-from-the-internet): {"question":"Who won the 2024 NBA Championship?"}
> Waiting for model... 
The Boston Celtics won the 2024 NBA Championship by defeating the Dallas Mavericks in the NBA Finals. The Celtics secured their 18th championship by winning the series 4-1, and Jaylen Brown was named the Finals MVP. 
 
Input: 
```
4. Notice that there is a thread id created for each input.
```
otto % otto run a1n4kn6    
ID        AGENT     THREAD    STATE      INPUT                    OUTPUT                                                                          CREATED
r1rpv7f   a1n4kn6   t15qs24   continue   who won 2024 superbowk   The Kansas City Chiefs won the 2024 Super Bowl (Super Bowl LVIII) by defea...   1 minute ago
r1wdm4j   a1n4kn6   t1dxp97   continue   who won 2024 nba         The Boston Celtics won the 2024 NBA Championship by defeating the Dallas M...   23 seconds ago
```

**Expected Behavior:**
1. There should be the same thread id used for all the inputs .
author: sangee2004

comments.body: Not able to reproduce this with the latest version of Otto8 and the CLI. Moving to "Testing" for verification.
This issue is not seen anymore when testing with latest builds.

comments.body: On thread there is a field Description that will be populated by otto with the thread description using AI.
This si

title: When Invoke causes an error communicate that error to the caller
body:
I sent an invoke request to Otto and got an empty response with 200OK.
```
POST - /invoke/<agent>

200OK 
```

This was confusing, I couldn't get any agent I had to respond to me. Eventually I looked at the runs and saw a lot of this.

```json
{
    "id": "r1znqms",
    "created": "2024-09-16T09:36:10-05:00",
    "threadID": "t17lpjw",
    "agentID": "a1fl2rs",
    "input": "",
    "state": "error",
    "error": "run encountered an error: prompt event occurred when prompt was not allowed: Message: Please provide your OpenAI API key:\nFields: [key]\nSensitive: true with error output: "
}
```

I would expect this to have caused the original invoke to at least have a non-200 status code. Ideally this would have also returned the error message.
author: tylerslaton

comments.body: Repro by unsetting your openai credential and POSTing to invoke
These errors now show up in the UI. If you change your OpenAI key to be something invalid and try to chat with an agent, you will see an error appear.

When testing with latest builds, 

1. Update OpenAI provider with an invalid OpenAI key 

2. Following errors are presented to the user when chatting with agents that have models set to "Use system Default"

```
failed to run: failed calling model for completion: error, status code: 502, message: failed to get model: default model alias "llm" is not configured
```
